task_summary: The robot arm pours the contents from the cup into the mug, following a perception-to-action sequence and retreating when finished.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robot arm with a two-finger gripper pouring liquid (or simulated contents) from a handled cup into a mug positioned on a table. The sequence follows perception of both source (cup) and target (mug), approach and alignment over the mug, execution of a pouring motion by tilting the cup with a controlled angle over the mug, and retreating once pouring is complete. Visual alignment and verification steps are implied by the frames.
preconditions: Cup is grasped by robot gripper
Mug is present and correctly positioned
stepwise_plan: Detect target mug and confirm visibility
Approach the mug with the cup
Align the cup over the mug
Pour from cup into mug with a controlled tilt
success_criteria: Cup is positioned properly above mug
Pour action is executed with tilt angle
failure_and_recovery: Cup or mug not detected: re-attempt perception
Pour incomplete: repeat pour if possible
Collision during approach: retreat and realign
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after the retreat action post-pour and upon safe separation of cup from mug.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the source cup is visible for manipulation.
Detects the cup using visual sensors within a set timeout.
Checks if the target mug is visible for pouring.
Detects the mug using visual sensors within a set timeout.
Moves the cup above the mug at a specified height.
Precise approach and alignment of the cup (held in gripper) to target position over mug.
Pours the contents from the cup to the mug with a 90-degree tilt.
Retracts the cup after the pouring operation.

failure_modes: Pour fails due to improper tilt
recovery_strategy: Retry perception step on cup/mug loss
Abort and retry approach on failed alignment
Abort pour if stability is lost; replan
assumptions: The instruction lacks details about amount and pour_rate; assumed null.
Frames [0]-[8] show that the robot is already grasping the cup at all times.
The cup is poured into an object visually confirmed to be a mug.
No explicit grasp or place action used, as hand never releases object.
All poses, angles, durations, and action IDs inferred visually, not named in the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Cup is positioned and tilted appropriately above mug
Contents are transferred into mug with minimal to no spillage
Cup retracts after pour and is clear of mug
